definitions.definition: A mythological creature (usually humanoid and undead ) said to feed on the blood or life energy of the living .
examples: Bram Stoker's novel Dracula built on centuries-old stories of vampires and also encouraged new growth of the mythology.

definitions.definition: A person with habits traditionally ascribed to (literal) vampires, such as heliophobia , being a night owl , having pale skin, and so on.
examples: Somehow I doubt that Kelly will want to go surfing with us — she's such a vampire that she might recoil from the sun, lol!

definitions.definition: A person with the medical condition porphyria cutanea tarda , colloquially known as vampirism , with effects such as photosensitivity and brownish-red stained teeth.
A blood- sucking bat ; vampire bat ( Desmodus rotundus )
A person who drains one's time, energy, money, etc.
examples: You have to be careful what you tell her, because she's such a vampire for drama.

definitions.definition: A vamp : a seductive woman who exploits men.
A medical technician who works with patients' blood ; especially, a phlebotomist .
Synonym of anti-ship missile ( ASM ), particularly an incoming hostile one .

main_definition: A mythological creature (usually humanoid and undead ) said to feed on the blood or life energy of the living . [from 1732]
secondary_definitions: ( colloquial , usually humorous ) A person with habits traditionally ascribed to (literal) vampires, such as heliophobia , being a night owl , having pale skin, and so on.
( colloquial , disrespectful ) A person with the medical condition porphyria cutanea tarda , colloquially known as vampirism , with effects such as photosensitivity and brownish-red stained teeth.
A blood- sucking bat ; vampire bat ( Desmodus rotundus ) [from later 18th c.]
( figurative , derogatory ) A person who drains one's time, energy, money, etc.
( dated ) A vamp : a seductive woman who exploits men.
( US , slang ) A medical technician who works with patients' blood ; especially, a phlebotomist .
( US naval jargon ) Synonym of anti-ship missile ( ASM ), particularly an incoming hostile one .
